LanguageData.TKUtils.Experimental: This setting is experimental and may change, or be removed, at any time.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TMagic.Warning: A RimWorld of Magic does not support class changes. Lifting this restriction may lead to unexpected side-effects.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Emojis.Label: Use emojis in some commands.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Emojis.Description: Emojis are used in place of text to help provide quick, easy, and compact information in dense commands, such as !mypawnhealth.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HairColor.Label: Dye viewer's hair color to match their chat color.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HairColor.Description: Twitch Toolkit, by default, dyes their pawn's hair color to match the color their username is. This setting allows you to disable this functionality in-case your viewers want a specific hair color.
LanguageData.TKUtils.GatewayPuff.Label: Create a small puff of smoke when something exits the gateway.
LanguageData.TKUtils.GatewayPuff.Description: If enabled, a puff of smoke will appear in-front of any new item stack when they appear out of the gateway.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EasterEggs.Label: Easter eggs
LanguageData.TKUtils.EasterEggs.Description: If enabled, the mod will occasionally do certain actions when certain criteria are met. You probably already know what one of those actions are if you used the gateway before.
LanguageData.TKUtils.DumpStyle.Label: Json output style
LanguageData.TKUtils.DumpStyle.Description: How ToolkitUtils will store its data. When single file is selected, all data will be merged into one massive file originally known as ShopExt.json. When multi-file is selected, all data will be stored in separate files for every unique set of data.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MinifyData.Label: Minify the shop data files.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MinifyData.Description: When enabled, the mod will save the shop data files with as little extra characters as possible. This typically means the file will be a single line, without any indentions.
LanguageData.TKUtils.OffloadShop.Label: Offload saving shop data to a separate thread.
LanguageData.TKUtils.OffloadShop.Description: By default, all data is saved on the game's thread. As a result, this tends to block the game's thread when large amounts of data needs to be written to disk. Enabling this setting instructs the mod to save all data using a separate thread.
LanguageData.TKUtils.DoPurchasesAsap.Label: Complete purchases even if the game is paused.
LanguageData.TKUtils.DoPurchasesAsap.Description: When enabled, the mod will complete purchases even if the game is paused.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TrueNeutral.Label: Turn neutral karma into true neutral instead of a small positive
LanguageData.TKUtils.TrueNeutral.Description: When enabled, the mod will adjust how Toolkit treats neutral events. By default, neutral purchases are a small positive event, which means viewers will gain karma from using them. Enabling this setting will stop neutral events from giving viewers a karma bump when purchased. They'll essentially be a truly neutral purchase.
LanguageData.TKUtils.BroadcasterUserType.Label: Broadcaster viewer type
LanguageData.TKUtils.BroadcasterUserType.Description: The type of viewer the broadcaster will count as. This setting only applies to coin gains. All other systems shouldn't be affected, and if they are, you can submit a bug report to the mod author that implemented the system.
LanguageData.TKUtils.StoreRate.Label: The number of items the store will process per tick.
LanguageData.TKUtils.StoreRate.Description: With a previous update, Utils made Toolkit's store immediately visible. Utils runs a background task to ensure the store is up-to-date with the latest items in the game. This setting changes how many items it will process per tick until complete.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinRate.Label: Show a viewer's calculated coin rate in the balance command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinRate.Description: When enabled, the balance command will include the viewer's income per coin reward cycle.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandParser.Label: Use Utils' flavor of command handling.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandParser.Description: Older users would remember this as its command parser.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandPrefix.Label: Command prefix
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandPrefix.Description:
The prefix to use for all Twitch Toolkit commands.
Prefixes cannot start with a:
 - /
 - .
 - contain spaces
LanguageData.TKUtils.PurchasePrefix.Label: Purchase prefix
LanguageData.TKUtils.PurchasePrefix.Description: The prefix to use as a substitue for !buy. Prefixes cannot start with a: - / - . - contain spaces
LanguageData.TKUtils.ToolkitStyleCommands.Label: Locate commands similar to how Twitch Toolkit does.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ToolkitStyleCommands.Description: Twitch Toolkit compares commands by checking to see if a message starts with a command, while ToolkitUtils checks to see if the first "word" is a command. If this is enabled, ToolkitUtils will mimic the old behavior, with the exception of case insensitivity. TL;DR: this lets !balloon be a valid form of the !bal command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandRouter.Label: Re-route messages away from Toolkit's thread
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandRouter.Description: When enabled, the mod will route message parsing off of Toolkit's thread. The general idea is to remove heavy code out of it to hopefully fix, or lessen, disconnects.
LanguageData.TKUtils.DecorateUtils.Label: Add a little star beside Utils in the mod list command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.VersionedModList.Label: Include mod versions in the mod list command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.VersionedModList.Description: Inserts mod versions, if Utils could find one, into the !installedmods command's output.
LanguageData.TKUtils.BuyItemBalance.Label: Show a viewer's remaining balance after buying an item.
LanguageData.TKUtils.BuyItemBalance.Description: Inserts the viewer's new balance after successfully buying an item. This does not work when the "confirmation messages" setting is disabled in Twitch Toolkit.
LanguageData.TKUtils.BuyItemFullSyntax.Label: Require viewers to use the mod's full item syntax before they can purchase an item.
LanguageData.TKUtils.BuyItemFullSyntax.Description: If enabled, viewers will not be able to purchase items that require a material and/or quality unless both are specified (if applicable)
LanguageData.TKUtils.LookupLimit.Label: Maximum number of results in the lookup command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.LookupLimit.Description: The maximum number of results that can be displayed in the !lookup command. Setting this to higher values may result in walls of text if a viewer uses with broad terms.
LanguageData.TKUtils.AlphaFavoriteColor.Label: Allow the transparency values in the favorite color command
LanguageData.TKUtils.AlphaFavoriteColor.Description: When enabled, the mod won't adjust the color's transparency to opaque.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Method.Label: How pawns should leave when the leave command is invoked.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Method.Description: The type of leave method that'll be used when a viewer uses the !leave command. The "Mental break" method will force the colonist to leave the colony, while the "Thanos" method will turn the colonist to dust.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Gear.Label: Colonists that leave by the leave command drop their inventory.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Gear.Description: If a viewer chooses to leave the colony via the !leave command, the mod will strip their equipment before they depart.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Temperature.Label: Show temperature information in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Temperature.Description: Include a pawn's temperature tolerance range in the !mypawngear command. Enabling this removes temperature information from !mypawnbody.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Apparel.Label: Show currently equipped apparel in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Apparel.Description: Include a pawn's current apparel in the !mypawngear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Armor.Label: Show armor values in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Armor.Description: Include armor protection values in the !mypawngear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Weapon.Label: Show currently equipped weapon in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Weapon.Description: Includes the weapon a pawn is currently equipped with in the !mypawngear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnHealth.Surgeries.Label: Show queued surgeries in the pawn health command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnHealth.Surgeries.Description: Includes currently queued surgeries in the !mypawnhealth command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnRelations.OpinionThreshold.D: The minimum opinion a pawn has to have of another before they'll show up in the command. The value will be used for both the negative (absolute) and positive opinion values
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnRelations.MinimalRelations.L: Only show important relationships in the pawn relations command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnRelations.MinimalRelations.D: When enabled, only direct relationships will be shown in the !mypawnrelations command. Opinion based relationships will be hidden, like friends and acquaintances.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Sort.Label: Sort work priorities in the pawn work command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Sort.Description: If enabled, work priorities will be sorted like the Work tab in the !mypawnwork command. This means work will be displayed as the Work tab from left to right.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Filter.Label: Filter work priorities in the pawn work command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Filter.Description: If enabled, disabled work priorities will be removed from the !mypawnwork command's output. This means work priorities a pawn is incapable of doing, or is not assigned to, will be omitted from the command's response.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HAR.PawnKinds.Label: Allow viewers to specify their pawn's kind when buying.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HAR.PawnKinds.Description: Completely disables the ability to specify a viewer's pawn kind when purchasing a pawn. Any pawn purchases will default to Human, even if it's disabled in the pawn kind config.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TMagic.Classes.Label: Allow viewers to change their classes.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TMagic.Classes.Description: If enabled, Utils will lift the restriction surrounding class changes in the trait events.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TMagic.ResetClass.Label: Reset class abilities when changed
LanguageData.TKUtils.TMagic.ResetClass.Description: If enabled, Utils will reset the viewer's abilities prior to giving them their new class. This means the mod will clear their old classes' abilities, then give their pawn the new class.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.Randomness.Label: Passion events
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.Randomness.Description: When enabled, this event will have a chance of inducing a random passion-related event, or fail completely.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.FailChance.Label: Fail chance
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.FailChance.Description: The percentage, from 0 to 100, that this event will fail outright. Should the purchase fail, the viewer will still be charged.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.HopChance.Label: Hop chance
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.HopChance.Description: The percentage, from 0 to 100, that this event will be applied to a random eligible skill instead of the specified skill.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.DecreaseChance.Label: Catastrophic fail chance
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.DecreaseChance.Descripti: The percentage, from 0 to 100, that this event will decrease the pawn's current passion instead of increasing it. This event can also happen along side the "passion hop event".
LanguageData.TKUtils.Passion.IncreaseChance.Descripti: The percentage, from 0 to 100, that this event will increase the pawn's current passion instead of decreasing it. This event can also happen along side the "passion hop event".
LanguageData.TKUtils.Backpack.AutoEquip.Label: Auto-equip purchased gear
LanguageData.TKUtils.Backpack.AutoEquip.Description: Whether or not pawns will automatically swap out their current gear for the ones purchased.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Heal.FairFights.Label: Fair fights
LanguageData.TKUtils.Heal.FairFights.Description: Whether or not viewers can use this heal event while in combat.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Gender.Label: Specify gender
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Gender.Description: Whether or not viewers can specify the gender of animals they purchase, if applicable.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Quality.Label: Specify quality
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Quality.Description: Whether or not viewers can specify the quality of their purchase, if applicable.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Stuff.Label: Specify stuff
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Stuff.Description: Whether or not viewers can specify the material of their purchase, if applicable.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Research.Label: Research required
LanguageData.TKUtils.Item.Research.Description: Whether or not viewers can only purcahse items that have been researched, assuming the item has a research prerequisites.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Coins.Tooltip: This tab contains the settings that change how the mod distrbutes coins, and the requirements viewers have to meet to earn said coins.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Cooldowns.Tooltip: This tab contains the settings that change how the cooldowns for the mod's events.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Karma.Tooltip: This tab contains the settings that change how the mod's karma system works, including how it affects the karma gain/loss when viewers purchase items or events through the mod's store. There's also settings to enforce some requirements on gifting coins.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Addons.Label: Add-ons
LanguageData.TKUtils.Addons.Tooltip: This tab contains the list of currently registered addons you have running, as well as provide a way of getting to their settings.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Store.Tooltip: This tab contains the settings that affect how the mod's store works.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Storyteller.Tooltip: This tab contains the settings that affect how the mod's polls work, plus a quick way to get to the mod's storyteller pack settings.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Viewers.Tooltip: This tab contains the settings that affect the bonuses viewers receive when they certain requirements, settings for the pawn queue system, as well as a quick way to edit viewer data.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EarningCoins.Label: Should viewers receive coins every {0} minutes?
LanguageData.TKUtils.EarningCoins.Singular.Label: Should viewers receive coins every minute?
LanguageData.TKUtils.EarningCoins.Description: Whether or not viewers will receive coins every {0} minutes. If disabled, viewers will not receive coins for watching the stream, but they may still purchase things from the store if it's enabled.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EarningCoins.Singular.Descriptio: Whether or not viewers will receive coins every minute. If disabled, viewers will not receive coins for watching the stream, but they may still purchase things from the store if it's enabled.
LanguageData.TKUtils.StartingBalance.Label: The number of coins viewers start with.
LanguageData.TKUtils.StartingBalance.Description: When a viewer first uses the mod, or is freshly reset through the "Viewers" menu, this will be the amount of coins the viewer will have.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinInterval.Label: The number of minutes between each coin reward.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinInterval.Description: The amount of time, in minutes, each coin reward cycle will be. While you can set this to whatever you want, it's advised to keep it within a reasonable amount of time, like 1-10 minutes.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinAmount.Label: The base amount of coins a viewer will receive each reward cycle.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinAmount.Description: The amount of coins a viewer will receive every {0} minutes. This setting is just the base amount of coins. Viewers also have certain multipliers that affect how much coins they'll obtain, as well as an additonal bonus to the base value depending on their viewer type.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinAmount.Singular.Description: The amount of coins a viewer will receive every minute. This setting is just the base amount of coins. Viewers also have certain multipliers that affect how much coins they'll obtain, as well as an additonal bonus to the base value depending on their viewer type.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MinimumPurchaseAmount.Label: The minimum amount of coins a viewer has to spend.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MinimumPurchaseAmount.Descriptio: The minimum amount of coins a viewer has to spend in order to purchase something through Toolkit's store. It's advised to keep this high enough to limit small purchase spam, but low enough to encourage small purchases.
LanguageData.TKUtils.UnlimitedCoins.Label: Should viewers have unlimited coins?
LanguageData.TKUtils.UnlimitedCoins.Description: Whether or not viewers should have unlimited coins. While this setting is active, viewers will be able to purchase items/events they normally can't afford, however depending on the event purchased, viewers may see a decrease in their coins. If you notice this, you can simply report the problem to the mod that added the event.
LanguageData.TKUtils.RequireParticipation.Label: Require viewers to participate in chat to earn coins
LanguageData.TKUtils.RequireParticipation.Description: Whether or not viewers must actively talk in chat to earn the full amount of coins they'll normally earn. The period of time between each stage of decay can be configured below.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HalfCoins.Label: The amount of minutes before viewers earn half their coins.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HalfCoins.Description: The amount of time, in minutes, a viewer would have to be inactive for to earn half their full coins, multipliers and bonuses included.
LanguageData.TKUtils.NoCoins.Label: The amount of minutes before viewers earn no coins.
LanguageData.TKUtils.NoCoins.Description: The amount of time, in minutes, a viewer would have to be inactive for to earn 0 coins instead of the full coins, multipliers and bonuses included.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CooldownPeriod.Label: The amount of days an event will be on cooldown for.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CooldownPeriod.Description: When a viewer purchases an event, it'll accumulate a "use". Once the event hits its max number of uses, and the "events have cooldowns" setting is enabled, it'll go on cooldown for {0} days. Viewers won't be able to purchase that event again until it's off its cooldown.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CooldownPeriod.Singular.Descript: When a viewer purchases an event, it'll accumulate a "use". Once the event hits its max number of uses, and the "events have cooldowns" setting is enabled, it'll go on cooldown for day. Viewers won't be able to purchase that event again until it's off its cooldown.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaxEvents.Label: Limit events by karma type?
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaxEvents.Description: Karma type limits are the way of restricting how many events of a given karma type can be purchased within a given period of time. When an event is used, its karma type will gain a "use". When the karma type reaches the maximum, all events of that karma type won't be usable the karma type itself is off cooldown.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaxBadEvents.Label: The maximum number of bad event purchases.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaxGoodEvents.Label: The maximum number of good event purchases.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaxNeutralEvents.Label: The maximum number of neutral event purchases.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaxItemEvents.Label: The maximum number of item purchases.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EventCooldowns.Label: Should events have cooldowns?
LanguageData.TKUtils.EventCooldowns.Description: Whether or not events should have cooldowns
LanguageData.TKUtils.StartingKarma.Label: The amount of karma viewers start with.
LanguageData.TKUtils.StartingKarma.Description: When a viewer first uses the mod, or is freshly reset through the "Viewers" menu, this will be the amount of karma the viewer will have.
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaCap.Label: The maximum amount of karma a viewer can obtain.
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaCap.Description: When a viewer purchases good events, they'll accumulate karma, until they hit this limit. It's recommended to set this value to something higher than a viewer's starting karma, and balanced around the amount of coins a viewer can gain every coin interval.
LanguageData.TKUtils.NegativeKarma.Label: Should the mod prevent viewers from reaching negative karma?
LanguageData.TKUtils.NegativeKarma.Description: When viewers purchase negative events, their karma drops by a certain percentage depending on the karma type and the event's cost. By default, the mod will prevent viewers from reaching negative karma as they start to lose coins, rather than gain them. Disabling this setting removes that safe guard.
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaMinimum.Label: The minimum amount of karma a viewer can obtain.
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaMinimum.Description: As mentioned above, a viewer's karma drops when purchasing negative events. Depending on your settings, the minimum amount of karma a viewer can have may be 1% or the value here. The former depends on whether or not the "negative karma protection" setting above is enabled.
LanguageData.TKUtils.GiftingRequiresKarma.Label: Giving and receiving coins requires a karma
LanguageData.TKUtils.GiftingRequiresKarma.Description: When enabled, giving and receiving karma requires the viewers on both sides to meet a certain level of karma before they can give coins through the gift coins command, and receive coins through the gift coins command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaForGifting.Label: The minimum amount of karma a viewer must have to give coins
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaForGifting.Description: The minimum amount of karma a viewer must have to give coins through the gift coins command. Viewers that don't meet this requirement won't be able to gift coins to anyone else in chat.
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaForReceiving.Label: The minimum amount of karma a viewer must have to receive coins
LanguageData.TKUtils.KarmaForReceiving.Description: The minimum amount of karma a viewer must have to receive coins through the gift coins command. Viewers that don't meet this requirement won't be able to be given coins from anyone else in chat.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Karma.Description: The amount of karma {0} will receive, or lose, after purchasing an event or item. {1}, internally, are viewers with karma between {2} and {3}.
LanguageData.TKUtils.GoodKarma.Label: Good karma bonus for events and items
LanguageData.TKUtils.NeutralKarma.Label: Neutral karma bonus for events and items
LanguageData.TKUtils.BadKarma.Label: Bad karma penalty for events and items
LanguageData.TKUtils.PurchaseList.Label: Link to purchase list
LanguageData.TKUtils.PurchaseList.Description: A link to a website containing the prices of items and events in the mod. It'll be displayed in the !{0} command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PurchaseConfirmations.Label: Send feedback when a viewer purchases something
LanguageData.TKUtils.PurchaseConfirmations.Descriptio: When enabled, a confirmation message will be sent to the chat when a viewer purchases an item or event.
LanguageData.TKUtils.RaidersAreViewers.Label: Rename raiders after viewers in chat
LanguageData.TKUtils.RaidersAreViewers.Description: When enabled, the mod will rename any raid or military aid full of after viewers in chat.
LanguageData.TKUtils.IncludeMinifiables.Label: Include minifiable items in the mod's store
LanguageData.TKUtils.IncludeMinifiables.Description: When enabled, the mod will include minifiable buildings inside of the mod's store.
LanguageData.TKUtils.VoteTime.Label: Voting time
LanguageData.TKUtils.VoteTime.Description: The amount of time, in seconds, viewers have to vote for polls generated by Twitch Toolkit.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaximumOptions.Label: Maximum choices
LanguageData.TKUtils.MaximumOptions.Description: The maximum amount of choices Twitch Toolkit's polls are allowed to have.
LanguageData.TKUtils.OptionsToChat.Label: Send polls to chat
LanguageData.TKUtils.OptionsToChat.Description: When enabled, the mod will send the poll, and its choices, to chat.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ShowVoteWindow.Label: Display the poll in-game
LanguageData.TKUtils.ShowVoteWindow.Description: When enabled, the mod will open a window in-game displaying the poll, its choices, and its remaining time.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EnlargeWindow.Label: Enlarge vote window
LanguageData.TKUtils.EnlargeWindow.Description: When enabled, the mod will enlarge the text displayed on the vote window. This makes it easier for viewers to see the choices on stream without having to enable "send polls to chat".
LanguageData.TKUtils.EditStorytellerPacks.Label: Edit storyteller packs
LanguageData.TKUtils.NameQueue.Label: Allow viewers to join the name queue?
LanguageData.TKUtils.NameQueue.Description: When enabled, viewers will be able to use !{0} to join the name queue.
LanguageData.TKUtils.UnnamedNotification.Description: When enabled, an "alert" message will be displayed when an unnamed colonist is detected. Alerts are messages that appear towards the top of the bottom-right notification area.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EnableQueueCost.Label: Charge viewers to join the name queue?
LanguageData.TKUtils.EnableQueueCost.Description: When enabled, viewers will be charged {0} coin(s) to join the name queue. The cost can be configured below.
LanguageData.TKUtils.QueueCost.Label: Cost to join queue
LanguageData.TKUtils.QueueCost.Description: The amount of coins viewers will have to pay in order to join the name queue.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ExtraCoins.Label: Extra coins
LanguageData.TKUtils.ExtraCoins.Description: The amount of additional coins a viewer receives after the mod multiplies the base amount of coins viewers receive by the viewer's karma percentage.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinMultiplier.Label: Coin bonus multiplier
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinMultiplier.Description: A percentage indicating how much a viewer's coins will be multiplied by when awarding coins. This multiplier is applied after the viewer's extra coins is applied.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ExtraVotes.Label: Extra votes
LanguageData.TKUtils.ExtraVotes.Description: The amount of extra votes a viewer has when voting on polls.
